title: Implement Games screen with fun activities
description:
Add engaging educational games:

title: Add reduced motion support
description:
Some children are sensitive to motion:
- Check @Environment(\.accessibilityReduceMotion)
- Provide non-animated alternatives
- Reduce confetti intensity
- Simplify transitions
- Keep essential feedback visible without motion
close_reason: Added @Environment accessibilityReduceMotion checks throughout: BounceModifier provides static fallback, ConfettiView shows static circles instead of falling confetti, PrimaryButtonStyle uses opacity change instead of scale, ContentView uses simple opacity transitions, LessonCompleteScreen shows content immediately without animated reveal

title: Implement streak system properly
description:

- Show streak-break warning if missed a day
- Streak milestones (3, 7, 14, 30 days) with rewards
- 'Streak freeze' feature (skip 1 day without breaking)

title: Build Quick Practice feature

title: Implement data persistence with SwiftData
description:
Currently ALL progress is lost on app restart. Need to persist:

- mathProgress dictionary
- readingProgress dictionary

Use SwiftData @Model for ChildProfile. Add @Query in AppState to load on launch.
close_reason: Implemented SwiftData persistence - saves child profile, progress (stars per level), and streak tracking across app launches

title: Fix levels showing identical content
description:
BUG: All 3 levels show SAME 6 activities because level parameter is ignored.

In LessonView.swift, createMathCards(level:) and createReadingCards(level:) need to:
- Level 1: Numbers 1-3, Letters A-C
- Level 2: Numbers 4-6, Letters D-F  
- Level 3: Numbers 7-10, Letters G-J

Also increase difficulty:
- More distractor options at higher levels
- Longer blending words
- Faster expected response times
close_reason: Fixed level content - each level now has unique content: Math L1=1-3, L2=4-6, L3=7-10; Reading L1=A-C, L2=D-F, L3=G-J

title: Implement Progress screen
description:
Tab bar shows Progress but it's non-functional. Build:

- Time spent learning

close_reason: Implemented Progress screen with overview stats, subject progress cards, achievement badges, and areas to practice. Implemented Settings screen with profile editing, sound/haptics toggles, app info, and reset progress functionality. Both screens include full accessibility support.

title: Support Dynamic Type
description:
Text should scale for vision needs:
- Use .font(.title) style sizes (not fixed points)
- Test with largest accessibility sizes
- Ensure layouts don't break at extreme sizes
- Add ScrollView where needed for overflow
close_reason: App already uses semantic font sizes (.title, .headline, .caption, etc.) throughout for body text which automatically support Dynamic Type. Large fixed-size fonts (36-120pt) are intentional for educational content display (letters, numbers, emojis) and are already accessibility-friendly due to their size. ScrollViews already wrap content in all screens.

title: Add activity instructions and hints
description:
Kids may not understand what to do. Add:

- 'Help' button showing hint
- Auto-hint after 10 seconds of inactivity

- First-time tutorial overlay for new activity types

title: Choose exciting, available app name
description:
Current name 'KidLearn' is generic and likely unavailable. Brainstorm and validate:
- Name should be memorable, fun, and child-friendly
- Check App Store availability
- Consider: alliteration, made-up words, action verbs
- Ideas: NumberNinja, LetterLand, BrainSprout, Sparkle Academy, LearnLoop, KidSpark, WonderLearn, Clever Cubs, BrightStart
- Must work for both math AND reading focus
close_reason: Renamed app to Sproutling - updated all code, project files, documentation, and beads prefix

title: Integrate sound system with activities
description:
CRITICAL: SoundManager is fully implemented but NEVER CALLED anywhere in the app.

Files to modify:
- MathActivities.swift: Add sounds for correct/incorrect, number reveal
- ReadingActivities.swift: Add letter sounds via speakLetterSound(), word pronunciation
- LessonView.swift: Add celebration sound on completion
- Components.swift: Add tap sounds to buttons

Sound triggers needed:
- Correct answer → playSound(.correct) + success haptic
- Wrong answer → playSound(.incorrect) + error haptic  
- Button tap → playSound(.tap)
- Lesson complete → playSound(.celebration)
- Letter reveal → speakLetterSound(letter)
- Number reveal → speakNumber(number)
close_reason: Integrated sounds into all activities: math (number reveal, matching, counting), reading (letter sounds, matching, phonics blending), and lesson completion celebration
